00021 /** \file rfm12_extra.h
00022  * \brief rfm12 library extra features header
00023  * \author Hans-Gert Dahmen
00024  * \author Peter Fuhrmann
00025  * \author Soeren Heisrath
00026  * \version 0.9.0
00027  * \date 08.09.09
00028  *
00029  * This header declares all stuff related to extra features.
00030  *
00031  * \note It is usually not required to explicitly include this header,
00032  * as this is already done by rfm12.h.
00033  */
00034  
00035  /******************************************************
00036  *                                                    *
00037  *    NO  C O N F I G U R A T I O N  IN THIS FILE     *
00038  *                                                    *
00039  *      ( thou shalt not change lines below )         *
00040  *                                                    *
00041  ******************************************************/
00042  
00043 #ifndef _RFM12_EXTRA_H
00044 #define _RFM12_EXTRA_H
00045 
00046 /************************
00047  * amplitude modulation receive mode
00048 */
00049 
00050 #if RFM12_RECEIVE_ASK
00051          /** \name States and buffer size for the amplitude modulated receive feature.
00052          * \anchor ask_defines
00053          * \note You need to define RFM12_RECEIVE_ASK as 1 to enable this.
00054          * \see rfrxbuf_t and ISR(ADC_vect, ISR_NOBLOCK)
00055          * @{
00056          */
00057          //! The ASK receive buffer size.
00058          #define RFM12_ASK_RFRXBUF_SIZE 55
00059          //! The ASK receive buffer is empty.
00060          #define RFM12_ASK_STATE_EMPTY 0
00061          //! The ASK receive buffer is active.
00062          #define RFM12_ASK_STATE_RECEIVING 1
00063          //! The ASK receive buffer is full.
00064          #define RFM12_ASK_STATE_FULL 2
00065          //@}
00066 
00067          //! The receive buffer structure for the amplitude modulated receive feature.
00068          /** \note You need to define RFM12_RECEIVE_ASK as 1 to enable this.
00069          * \see ask_rxbuf (for further usage instructions) and ISR(ADC_vect, ISR_NOBLOCK)
00070          * \headerfile rfm12.h
00071          */
00072          typedef struct
00073          {
00074                   //! A pointer into the buffer, used while receiving.
00075                   volatile uint8_t p;
00076                   
00077                   //! The buffer's state.
00078                   /** \see See \ref ask_defines "ASK mode defines" for a list of possible states */
00079                   volatile uint8_t state;
00080                   
00081                   //! The data buffer
00082                   uint8_t  buf[RFM12_ASK_RFRXBUF_SIZE];
00083          } rfm12_rfrxbuf_t;
00084 
00085          //see rfm12_extra.c for more documentation
00086          extern rfm12_rfrxbuf_t ask_rxbuf;
00087          
00088          //see rfm12_extra.c for more documentation   
00089          void adc_init(void);
00090 #endif /* RFM12_RECEIVE_ASK */
00091 
00092 
00093 /************************
00094  * amplitude modulated raw tx mode
00095 */
00096  
00097 #if RFM12_TRANSMIT_ASK
00098          //see rfm12_extra.c for more documentation
00099          void rfm12_ask_tx_mode(uint8_t setting);
00100          
00101          
00102          //see rfm12_extra.c for more documentation
00103          static inline void rfm12_tx_on(void);
00104 
00105          
00106          //see rfm12_extra.c for more documentation
00107          static inline void rfm12_tx_off(void);
00108 #endif /* RFM12_TRANSMIT_ASK  */
00109 
00110 
00111 /************************
00112  * rfm12 wakeup timer mode
00113 */
00114 
00115 #if RFM12_USE_WAKEUP_TIMER
00116          //this function sets the wakeup timer register
00117          //(see datasheet for values)
00118          //see rfm12_extra.c for more documentation
00119          void rfm12_set_wakeup_timer(uint16_t val);
00120 #endif /* RFM12_USE_WAKEUP_TIMER */
00121 
00122 
00123 /************************
00124  * rfm12 low battery detector mode
00125 */
00126 
00127 #if RFM12_LOW_BATT_DETECTOR
00128          /**\name States for the low battery detection feature .
00129          * \anchor batt_states
00130          * \see rfm12_set_batt_detector() and rfm12_get_batt_status()
00131          * @{
00132          */
00133          //! Battery voltage is okay.
00134          #define RFM12_BATT_OKAY 0
00135          //! Low battery voltage detected.
00136          #define RFM12_BATT_LOW 1
00137          //@}
00138 
00139          //this function sets the low battery detector and microcontroller clock divider register
00140          //(see datasheet for values)
00141          //see rfm12_extra.c for more documentation
00142          void rfm12_set_batt_detector(uint16_t val);
00143          
00144          //return the battery status
00145          //see rfm12_extra.c for more documentation
00146          uint8_t rfm12_get_batt_status(void);
00147 #endif /* RFM12_LOW_BATT_DETECTOR */
00148 
00149 #endif /* _RFM12_EXTRA_H */
